page.title: 11THE ENVIRONMENT-ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Ullapool stands on a raised beach and behind are rugged hills.The upland is bisected by the Ullapool River,flowing west from its source in Loch Achall.In the village the land is very fertile but the hills are rough pasture with a peat soil. An attractive walk follows the river's course to the point where it drains Loch Achall and then a footpath leads over the hill towards Ullapool. In Spring a carpet of primroses,blue- bells and crocuses grow and in Autumn rowan-tree berries decorate the landscape. The river supports a wide variety of wildlife including upland animals- red deer,foxes,badgers,otters adders, rabbits,stoats and herons and is home for salmon and trout-prey for otters. Numerous upland lochs provide habitats for brown trout and sticklebacks.
